books.author: by Glennon Doyle
books.description: The activist and public speaker describes her journey of listening to her inner voice.
books.name: UNTAMED

books.author: by Robin DiAngelo
books.description: Historical and cultural analyses on what causes defensive moves by white people and how this inhibits cross-racial dialogue.
books.name: WHITE FRAGILITY

books.author: by Ibram X. Kendi
books.description: A primer for creating a more just and equitable society through identifying and opposing racism.
books.name: HOW TO BE AN ANTIRACIST

books.author: by Judy Mikovits and Kent Heckenlively
books.description: The controversial virologist gives her account of her work over nearly four decades.
books.name: PLAGUE OF CORRUPTION

books.author: by Michelle Obama
books.description: The former first lady describes her journey from the South Side of Chicago to the White House, and how she balanced work, family and her husband’s political ascent.
books.name: BECOMING

books.author: by Erik Larson
books.description: An examination of the leadership of the prime minister Winston Churchill.
books.name: THE SPLENDID AND THE VILE

books.author: by James Nestor
books.description: A re-examination of a basic biological function and a look at the science behind ancient breathing practices.
books.name: BREATH

books.author: by Tara Westover
books.description: The daughter of survivalists, who is kept out of school, educates herself enough to leave home for university.
books.name: EDUCATED

books.author: by John M. Barry
books.description: An overview of the 1918 flu epidemic and cautionary tale for similar kinds of large-scale outbreaks.
books.name: THE GREAT INFLUENZA

books.author: by Michelle Alexander
books.description: A law professor takes aim at the “war on drugs,” mass incarceration and their impact on black men.
books.name: THE NEW JIM CROW

books.author: by Ron Chernow
books.description: A biography of the Union general of the Civil War and two-term president of the United States.
books.name: GRANT

books.author: by Mikel Jollett
books.description: The musician and author retraces his time growing up in an experimental commune and the difficulties he encountered after escaping it.
books.name: HOLLYWOOD PARK

books.author: by Ijeoma Oluo
books.description: A look at the contemporary racial landscape of the United States.
books.name: SO YOU WANT TO TALK ABOUT RACE

books.author: by Sonia Purnell
books.description: The true story of a Baltimore socialite who joined a spy organization during World War II and became essential to the French Resistance.
books.name: A WOMAN OF NO IMPORTANCE

books.author: by Layla F. Saad
books.description: Ways to understand and possibly counteract white privilege.
books.name: ME AND WHITE SUPREMACY
